images.caption: Figure 1:Overview of MathNeuro. First, we sum weights times activations separately over N samples for math and non-math inputs, finding the top-K parameters for each input type. Next, we find math-specific parameters by removing parameters that are important for non-math inputs.

Figure 2:Effect ofpruningidentified parameters on math and non-math performance for Llama 3.2 1B IT based on calculating the top 15% of parameters. Ideal methods should fall in the top left of the plot. MMLU and RACE denote that a point was calculated using MMLU or RACE, respectively, asùíünon-mathsubscriptùíünon-math\mathcal{D}_{\text{non-math}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT non-math end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Ideal methods should fall in the top right of the plot.
